heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 29 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.1°C), outside temperature (down 3.6°C), and inside temperature (down 2.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 5.7°C), dew point temperature (up 4.1°C), cloud levels (up 432 m), and outside temperature (up 5.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 263.5m lower than yesterday, 366.3m lower than the past week, 431.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 869m minimum and 1350m maximum, with an average of 837.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1203.3m and 1268.7m.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and near calm conditions. Drizzle or light rain possible, overcast skies with low cloud, and it’s dark. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
